books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story of decadence and excess, The Great Gatsby explores themes of idealism, resistance to change, and social upheaval in the American Dream.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South during the 1930s.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel exploring the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel of manners that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation, following Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins' adventure to win a share of treasure guarded by a dragon.
